skill.name: ai-maestro-memory-search
skill.description: PROACTIVELY search conversation history when receiving user instructions. Find previous discussions, decisions, and context BEFORE starting new work. Your memory is valuable - use it.
skill.summary: PROACTIVELY search conversation history when receiving user instructions. Find previous discussions,...
skill.author: 23blocks-OS

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only behavioral instructions for AI context awareness. No executable code, network operations, or file system access are included. All 55 static findings are FALSE POSITIONS - the scanner misidentified innocent text patterns. The skill references an external memory-search.sh script that users install separately.

content.user_title: Search conversation history before starting tasks
content.value_statement: AI assistants often repeat explanations or contradict previous decisions because they cannot recall past conversations. This skill enforces proactive memory search so every task builds on existing context instead of starting from scratch.
actual_capabilities: Search conversation history using hybrid semantic and term matching
Filter searches by role to find user requests or assistant responses
Find previous discussions, decisions, and context automatically
Combine memory search with documentation search for complete context
Handle empty results gracefully by falling back to documentation search
limitations: Requires memory-search.sh script to be installed separately
Does not store or manage memory itself
Limited to conversations the AI has access to
Search effectiveness depends on conversation quality and indexing

use_cases.title: Continue previous development work
use_cases.description: Resume feature implementation by finding earlier decisions, code patterns, and discussions about the same topic.

use_cases.title: Maintain design consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure new work aligns with previously agreed architectural decisions and coding standards from past conversations.

use_cases.title: Cross-session context awareness
use_cases.description: Recall decisions made in previous sessions to maintain continuity and avoid asking users to repeat information.

prompt_templates.title: Continue Working
prompt_templates.scenario: User asks to continue previous work

prompt_templates.title: Complete Context
prompt_templates.scenario: User asks about a new feature

output_examples.input: Continue working on the authentication system
output: Session 1: Decided to use JWT tokens with 1-hour expiry
Session 2: User requested OAuth2 integration for Google
Session 3: Backend team implemented refresh token rotation
The authentication module is in src/auth/ with OAuth2Handler in oauth.ts

output_examples.input: Fix the bug we discussed yesterday
output: Yesterday: Identified race condition in payment processing
Proposed fix: Added synchronized block around transaction update
The fix is in commit abc123 in the payment-service branch

output_examples.input: Add logging to the user service
output: No previous discussions about user service logging found.
Found: Follow existing logger pattern in src/utils/logger.ts

best_practices: Always search memory immediately when receiving any task, even if it seems new
Use semantic search mode when the user describes concepts differently than before
Combine memory search with documentation search for complete context
anti_patterns: Skipping memory search because you do not explicitly remember the topic
Assuming every request is new without checking conversation history
Waiting for the user to say remember when we before searching

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires the memory-search.sh script installed separately.

faq.question: How does memory search work?
faq.answer: The skill uses a hybrid approach combining semantic similarity with exact term matching to find relevant past conversations.

faq.question: What if memory search returns no results?
faq.answer: No results indicate this is a new topic. The skill then falls back to documentation search for additional context.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that only instructs the AI to search conversation history. It does not read or write files directly.

faq.question: How is data sent over the network?
faq.answer: This skill does not make any network calls. It references a local script that must be installed on your system.

faq.question: How is this different from regular context?
faq.answer: Regular context only includes the current conversation. Memory search accesses past conversations across sessions to prevent repetition.
